page.title: 06Housing in Sth Benfleet.
page.content: Most of the houses are built on land that was sold as plots when farms were broken up during the agricultural depression in the 19th century.Special trains were run from Fenchurch Street to bring Londoners to these sales and food was laid on in large tents to provide refreshment,including Kosher victuals when there was an unexpected influx of Jewish buyers.Plots were sold for about Â£10 to Â£35. Only four small farms are left.They are engaged in mixed dairy and arable farming and also have riding stables.Two of the farms are situated on Benfleet Downs and form part the Hadleigh Country Park.In addition,four fruit farms produce soft fruit,as well as apples, plums and pears and invite their customers to pick their own fruit.One of the two large nurseries advertises nationally and supplies by mail order.
